The Roosevelt Arch is a rusticated triumphal arch at the north entrance to 
Yellowstone National Park in Gardiner, Montana, USA. Constructed under the 
supervision of the U.S. Army at Fort Yellowstone, its cornerstone was laid down 
by President of the United States Theodore Roosevelt in 1903.
